actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 4:00 p.m. on March 14, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Monday, March 13, 2023 through Tuesday, March 21, 2023 as a "district work period".
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the Steil amendment; Agreed to without objection.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Steil, Amendment is the reported version of the bill, House Report 118-8 as reported by the Committee on House Administration.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 197 — "Providing for the expenses of certain committees of the House of Representatives in the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Friday, March 10, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 4:00 p.m. on Tuesday, March 14, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 419
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 143).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S. 619.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 140, H.J. Res. 27 and S. 619. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 140, under a structured rule. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 27 and S. 619, under closed rules. General debate is limited to one hour of debate on all measures.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 199. S. 619 — "To require the Director of National Intelligence to declassify information relating to the origin of COVID-19, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Nancy Mace to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
